intro: Plectronema candida, commonly known as the white thread moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Peltigeraceae. It is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves that are typically pale green to white in color. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on decaying wood or stone in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, called sori, are located on the underside of the leaves and contain the spores for propagation. Plectronema candida plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
